results.title: Fred Winter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
A film portrait of Fred Winter, one of Britain’s leading steeplechase jockeys. Fred started riding at the age of four; now in his thirties, his outstanding career has seen him winner of the Grand National, twice winner of the Champion Hurdle, and four times Champion Jockey. Sequences show him in action during races, at home with his wife and children in consultation with a trainer.

results.title: Spotlights: Fred Schepisi
results.brief_description: An Australian film director, producer and screenwriter. His credits include The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith (1978), Plenty (1985), Roxanne (1987), Six Degrees of Separation (1993), Mr. Baseball (1992) and Last Orders (2001). Fred talks about his love for the craft and offers a perspective on violence.

constellations_primary.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_primary.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

results.title: Fred Astaire: puttin' on his top hat
results.brief_description: Biographical documentary about the career of one of America’s most loved and respected dancers, Fred Astaire, from his early days on stage with his sister Adele through to starring on film with his equally famous dancing partner, Ginger Rogers. Includes interviews with Ginger Rogers, Hermes Pan, Hal Borne, Gene Kelly, Pandro S. Berman and Rudolf Nureyev and excerpts from “The Gay divorcee”, “Top hat”, “Swing time”, and “The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle” showing some of his most famous dance sequences. Narrated by Joanne Woodward.

results.title: Fred Astaire: change partners and dance
results.creator_credit: Educational Broadcasting Corporation, Public Television Stations and David Heeley
results.brief_description: The famous dancing partnership of Ginger Rogers and Fred Astaire ended in 1939 but this did not mean the end for Fred Astaire. In this documentary you will see Astaire “change partners and dance” like never before. Using excerpts from many of his films including “You’ll never get rich” (1941), “Daddy Long Legs” (1955), “Funny face” (1957), we meet some of those partners, often highly regarded in their own right, including Rita Hayworth, Betty Hutton, Leslie Caron, Audrey Hepburn and Barrie Chase. The passing decades reflect Astaire’s change in his dancing movements from swing and tap of the 1940s to cool jazz of the 1950s and 1960s. Also includes interviews with Leslie Caron, Barrie Chase, Bob Fosse, Rodolf Nureyev, Hermes Pan, Jerome Robbins, Roland Petit and others with some rare footage from Astaire’s first television appearance in 1958 on “Toast of the town”. Last but not least is an excerpt from his final television special in 1968 featuring the classic “Puttin’ on the ritz”. Contains b&w footage. Narrated by Joanne Woodward.

results.title: Freckle juice
results.brief_description: Animated version of a book by Judy Blume. Andrew Marcus is the kind of second grader that gets noticed for all the wrong reasons. Andrew has one simple wish. He wants lots of freckles all over his face and neck, just like Nicky, the boy who sits next to him. Unfortunately, Sharon, the class practical joker recognises Andrew’s freckle fixation.

results.title: Freaky Friday
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ron Miller and Gary Nelson
results.brief_description: A young Jodie Foster stars as Annabel Andrews, a precocious 13 year old who experiences a Friday unlike any other. Annabel and her mother simultaneously switch identities. While Annabel’s mother struggles through her daughter’s typing exam, band practice and unusual eating habits, Annabel is faced with running the household and looking after her younger brother. Both discover the other’s life is not as easy as they first imagined and things change for the better when they regain their own identities. Based on the book by Mary Rodgers. Cast includes Barbara Harris, John Astin, Patsy kelly, Dick Van patten, Vicki Schreck.

results.title: Freaks
results.brief_description: This controversial film was banned for over thirty years in some countries, including Australia. Using a group of circus and carnival performers who were all regarded as “freaks of nature” this unsettling film is about a malicious young woman who weds a carnival manager in order to gain his wealth. Her cruel treatment of the various circus performers prompts them to exact a vicious revenge. The final scenes in this movie are possibly some of the most harrowing in horror cinema history.

results.title: Frasquita
results.brief_description: Based on an operetta by Austrian composer Franz Lehar with lyrics by A.M. Willner and H. Reichert, “Frasquita” tells the romantic tale of a love triangle between Harald, a wealthy young Parisian (Hans Heinz Bollmann), his fiancee Dolly (Charlott Daudert) and Frasquita (Jarmila Novotna) a young gyspy girl who takes Harald’s fancy after a chance meeting. Music conducted by Franz Lehar. Cast also includes Heinz Ruhmann, Max Gulstorff, Hans Moser, Rudolf Carl, Franz Schafheitlin. Dialogue, lyrics and credits in German. No English subtitles.

results.title: Fraser's River
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tim Wilson and Gordon Sparling
results.brief_description: This film traces the Fraser River from its source in the Rocky Mountains to its mouth, where the city of Vancouver stands. The influence of the Fraser as a provincial lifeline of commerce and communication, and as a transportation link with the rest of Canada, is shown.
